intro: Pygmaeocereus bieblii, commonly known as the dwarf moon cactus, is a small cacti species native to Mexico. It features a short, cylindrical stem with a single, rounded, white or pale green areola. The plant produces small, white flowers during the summer months, which are often nocturnal in bloom. It is a low-growing plant, typically reaching only a few centimeters in height. Due to its compact size and unique appearance, it is popular among cactus enthusiasts for its ornamental value.
